name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Wisconsin research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Wisconsin ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Wisconsin ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Wisconsin research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Wisconsin research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Wisconsin Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Wisconsin research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Wisconsin Overview—2:16

  3. Follow this research study for Wisconsin ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Wisconsin Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Wisconsin research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Wisconsin Resources
    ☆ AC—Wisconsin State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Wisconsin Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Wisconsin Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Wisconsin in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Wisconsin

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for Wisconsin.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Wisconsin in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Wisconsin
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Wisconsin archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Wisconsin archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Wisconsin archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Wisconsin Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Wisconsin State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Wisconsin.
  3. Explore the Wisconsin Dept of Archives site.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Wisconsin.
  5. Explore local and county histories on the Wisconsin Historical Society site.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Wisconsin genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Wisconsin research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Wisconsin ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Wisconsin city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Wisconsin Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Wisconsin city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Wisconsin city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Wisconsin ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Wisconsin city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Wisconsin research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Wisconsin County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Wisconsin.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Wisconsin Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Wisconsin research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Wisconsin Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Wisconsin Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Wisconsin.
Regional/Local Societies

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Wisconsin research.
  2. Explore the Wisconsin research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Wisconsin research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Wisconsin in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Wisconsin Societies

  2. Explore the Wisconsin State Genealogical Society site.

  3. Explore the Milwaukee County Genealogical Society site.

  4. Explore the Wisconsin Historical Society site.
  5. Explore Wisconsin genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Wisconsin.
